p: The foundation for employing sol-gel chemistry to obtain F-SiNPs is rooted in the knowledge that reactive silanes, including alkoxysilanes, halosilanes, and silanols will easily undergo hydrolysis and condensation [ 31]. Hydrolysis can be achieved in a number of ways, including heat, excess water, and acid or base catalysis. Sol-gel techniques can be used in a “top-down” or “bottom-up” fashion. Scheme 1 shows a general top-down and bottom-up method for the preparation of F-SiNPs from alkoxysilanes.
